messages.title: What future for our NHS?
messages.content: Martin Horwood wants to hear your views

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fighting unjustified plans by NHS bosses to cut 200 beds at local hospitals. Protecting vital local health services.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet suggests tactical voting considerations by showing the past election results in Cheltenham and noting 'It's always a two horse race in Cheltenham'.

issues.economy: Mentions Labour's mismanagement of the economy resulting in a dire financial situation and Labour’s bureaucracy let down the NHS with too much money spent on non-front-line services.
issues.health: Fighting plans to cut 200 beds at local hospitals and protect local health services. Believes NHS can be better with every penny of NHS spending going where it is most needed so we can all continue to rely on a free and fair NHS in the future.

politicalExperience.achievements: Fought cuts and closures to maternity services, Battledown children’s ward and mental health services.

images.caption: Martin Horwood has been fighting for a fair and free NHS since 2005
